partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.1 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule:
(a) Provided that the right of appeal has not been denied under rule 70.5, a party to a hearing may appeal a protest committee’s decision or its procedures, but not the facts found.
(b)  A boat may appeal when she is denied a hearing required by rule 63.1.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.2 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: A protest committee may request confirmation or correction of its decision.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.3 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: An appeal under rule 70.1 or a request by a protest committee under rule 70.2 shall be sent to the national authority with which the organizing authority is associated under rule 89.1.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.3 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY Continued
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: However, if boats will pass through the waters of more than one national authority while racing, an appeal or request shall be sent to the national authority where the finishing line is located, unless the sailing instructions identify another national authority.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.4 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: A club or other organization affiliated to a national authority may request an interpretation of the rules, provided that no protest or request for redress that may be appealed is involved. The interpretation shall not be used for changing a previous protest committee decision.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.5 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: There shall be no appeal from the decisions of an international jury constituted in compliance with Appendix N. Furthermore, if the notice of race or the sailing instructions so state, the right of appeal may be denied provided that...

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.5 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY Continued
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: (a) it is essential to determine promptly the result of a race that will qualify a boat to compete in a later stage of an event or a subsequent event (a national authority may prescribe that its approval is required for such a procedure);

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.5 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY Continued
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: (b) a national authority so approves for a particular event open only to boats entered by an organization affiliated to that national authority, a member of an organization affiliated to that national authority, or a personal member of that national authority; or

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.5 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY Continued
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: (c) approves for a particular event, provided the protest committee is constituted as required by Appendix N, except that only two members of the protest committee need be International Judges.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
70.6 APPEALS AND REQUESTS TO A NATIONAL AUTHORITY
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: Appeals and requests shall conform to Appendix R in the World Sailing Rules book.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
71.1 NATIONAL AUTHORITY DECISIONS
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: A person who has a conflict of interest or was a member of the protest committee shall not take any part in the discussion or decision on an appeal or a request for confirmation or correction.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
71.2 NATIONAL AUTHORITY DECISIONS
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: The national authority may uphold, change or reverse a protest committee’s decision including a decision on validity or a decision under rule 69.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
71.2 NATIONAL AUTHORITY DECISIONS Continued
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: Alternatively, the national authority may order that a hearing be reopened, or that a new hearing be held by the same or a different protest committee. When the national authority decides that there shall be a new hearing, it may appoint the protest committee.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
71.3 NATIONAL AUTHORITY DECISIONS
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: When from the facts found by the protest committee the national authority decides that a boat that was a party to a protest hearing broke a rule and is not exonerated, it shall penalize her, whether or not that boat or that rule was mentioned in the protest committee’s decision.

partFiveProtestsSectionD.Title:
SECTION D APPEALS
71.4 NATIONAL AUTHORITY DECISIONS
partFiveProtestsSectionD.Rule: 71.4 The decision of the national authority shall be final. The national authority shall send its decision in writing to all parties to the hearing and the protest committee, who shall be bound by the decision.
